uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.discovery.disco.impl

Class SparqlIndexedLogicConceptMatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.discovery.api.impl.AbstractMatcher
      • uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.discovery.disco.impl.SparqlIndexedLogicConceptMatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConceptMatcher, Matcher

    public class SparqlIndexedLogicConceptMatcher
extends AbstractMatcher
implements ConceptMatcher
    Rudimentary implementation of an in-memory index for logic matching. We are assuming here that the ontologies are in a remote server exposed through a SPARQL endpoint. If we can sit in the same server we should try and use the libraries from the store directly to avoid replicating the index.

      • listMatchesWithinRange

        public Map<URI,MatchResult> listMatchesWithinRange(URI origin,
                                          MatchType minType,
                                          MatchType maxType)
        Obtain all the matching resources with the URI of origin within the range of MatchTypes provided, both inclusive.
        Specified by:
        listMatchesWithinRange in interface Matcher
        Parameters:
        origin - URI to match
        minType - the minimum MatchType we want to obtain
        maxType - the maximum MatchType we want to obtain
        Returns:
        a Map containing indexed by the URI of the matching resource and containing the particular MatchResult. If no result is found the Map should be empty not null.

      • handleOntologyCreated

        public void handleOntologyCreated(OntologyCreatedEvent event)
        A new ontology has been uploaded to the server and we need to update the indexes
        Parameters:

      • handleOntologyDeleted

        public void handleOntologyDeleted(OntologyDeletedEvent event)
        An ontology has been deleted from the KB and we should thus update the indexes. By the time we want to process this event we won't know any longer which concepts need to be removed unless we keep this somewhere.
        Parameters:
        event - the ontology deletion event
